titles: M. Some laid open in his coulers VVherein the indifferent reader may easily see, hovve vvretchedly and loosely he hath handeled the cause against M. Penri. Done by an Oxford man, to his friend in Cambridge.
author: Throckmorton, Job, 1545-1601.
Greenwood, John, d. 1593, attributed name.
Penry, John, 1559-1593, attributed name.
notes: Erroneously attributed to John Greenwood and John Penry; actually by Job Throckmorton.--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Yale University. Library.
keywords: Some, Robert, 1542-1609. --  Godly treatise containing and deciding certaine questions .. touching the ministerie, sacraments, and Church --  Early works to 1800.
Penry, John, 1559-1593. --  Defence of that which hath bin written in the questions of the ignorant ministerie --  Early works to 1800.
